This is the default waypoint you may place to set a patrol path for a creature or NPC.
1. Create the creature and either use its current Tag or fill in a new one.
2. Place or make sure the WalkWayPoints() is within the body of the On Spawn script for the creature.
3. Place a series of waypoints along the route you wish the creature to walk.
4. Select all of the newly created waypoints and right click. Choose the Create Set option.
5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

3. Place a series of waypoints along the route you wish the creature to walk.
4. Select all of the newly created waypoints and right click. Choose the Create Set option.
5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

Usage:

Once again this a Tag trick in use with a area "onenter" and "exit" scripts. 

The OnEnter Spawns them, the OnExit cleans them up. Using the Tag..

SPAWN_PLACETAGHERE_XXXX_XXXX

Example:

SPAWN_NW_SKELETON_OOOX_X_01

1) You must Keep the "SPAWN_" Part in the front. 
2) Place the Tag of the creature you wish to Spawn in, Tag and ResRef must be the SAME. 
3) The Next "_XXXX" is time of Spawn in. First is Dawn, Day, Dusk and then Night. If a "X" is found in the Slot then that time of Day it will spawn in. If ANYTHING else is found then that time is not going to spawn the creature in. 
4) The Next "_X" is if you want the creature to Walk Randomly Around. To have him walk the Waypoints place a "W" there.
5) The Last "XXX" is if you want to give him a unique TAG, usueful for custom waypoint following. Just place a Number in there, valid is 001-999 or use letters.
6) Place the Waypoint down.

Last. Example: 

SPAWN_NW_SKELETON

Leaving off the extra will have the creature Spawn durring anytime of day and Randomly walk around.

5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.
